attributes.action: Place tighter controls or, if necessary, penalties on individuals working as "Street Canvassers" for Charities or Companies for harassment and other threatening behaviour
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
More and more people recently are being subjected to blatant harrassment by individuals working as "Street Canvassers" or "Street Charity Workers".

The type of behaviour reported includes:

Deliberately walking in front of the intended "target", 
Making lewd and/or offensive remarks in an attempt to gain a persons attention, 
Interrupting private conversations, 
following members of the public until they stop, 
Not accepting "no" for an answer and continuing to follow and intimidate (or even bully) people, 
Approaching people in areas such as the beach or sitting outside bars/pubs - these are surely areas where people don't expect to be approached in this way?

We are not suggesting that charities or companies should not be allowed to use "Street Canvassers" for fundraising purposes.  However, far too often, the tactics employed by such individuals is utterly unacceptable and must be punishable to the full extent of the law.
